commands.title: Code Quicken: Insert an import/require statement
Code Quicken: Fix broken import/require statements

codeQuicken.history.description: Set the maximum number of recently selected items when adding an import/require statement.

codeQuicken.javascript.syntax.description: Insert either ES2015's import or AMD's require syntax.

codeQuicken.javascript.grouping.description: Allow grouping multiple-imports if and only if "codeQuicken.javascript.syntax" is set to "import". For example, `import { foo, bar } from 'zoo';`

codeQuicken.javascript.fileExtension.description: Insert JS/JSX file extension to the path.

codeQuicken.javascript.indexFile.description: Insert "index" file name with JS/JSX file extension to the path.

codeQuicken.javascript.quoteCharacter.description: Insert either single quote or double quote as a string enclosure.

codeQuicken.javascript.predefinedVariabl.description: Replace the given file-name keys with its respective variable-name values. The file-name keys must be written in regular expression. For example, setting this to `{ "foo-(\\d)+": "bar_$1" }` writes `const bar_123 = require("./foo-123.js");`

codeQuicken.javascript.variableNamingCon.description: Define variable naming convention. This has no effects on "codeQuicken.javascript.predefinedVariableNames"

codeQuicken.javascript.filteredFileList.description: Filter the files shown in the list when adding an import/require statement. Both keys and values must be written in regular expression. For example, you are working on a file named "foo.js", and you want to see only the files ended with ".spec.js" in the list when adding an import statement, then you must set this to `{ "/foo\\.js$": "\\.spec\\.js$" }`

codeQuicken.typescript.grouping.description: Allow grouping multiple-imports if and only if "codeQuicken.typescript.syntax" is set to "import". For example, `import { foo, bar } from 'zoo';`

codeQuicken.typescript.fileExtension.description: Insert JS/JSX/TS/TSX file extension to the path.

codeQuicken.typescript.indexFile.description: Insert "index" file name with JS/JSX/TS/TSX file extension to the path.

codeQuicken.typescript.quoteCharacter.description: Insert either single quote or double quote as a string enclosure.

codeQuicken.typescript.predefinedVariabl.description: Replace the given file-name keys with its respective variable-name values. The file-name keys must be written in regular expression. For example, setting this to `{ "foo-(\\d)+": "bar_$1" }` writes `const bar_123 = require("./foo-123.ts");`

codeQuicken.typescript.variableNamingCon.description: Define variable naming convention. This has no effects on "codeQuicken.typescript.predefinedVariableNames"

codeQuicken.typescript.filteredFileList.description: Filter the files shown in the list when adding an import/require statement. Both keys and values must be written in regular expression. For example, you are working on a file named "foo.ts", and you want to see only the files ended with ".spec.ts" in the list when adding an import statement, then you must set this to `{ "/foo\\.ts$": "\\.spec\\.ts$" }`

codeQuicken.stylus.syntax.description: Insert either @import or @require. See also http://stylus-lang.com/docs/import.html

codeQuicken.stylus.fileExtension.description: Insert STYL file extension to the path.

codeQuicken.stylus.indexFile.description: Insert STYL file extension to the path.

codeQuicken.stylus.quoteCharacter.description: Insert either single quote or double quote as a string enclosure.
